page.title: 18Places of Worship. (Part 1)
page.content: {Bordesley Abbey}was a Cistercian Abbey built in the twelfth century and destroyed in the sixteenth century by Henry VIII.{Archaeologists}have been excavating it for about 100 years and now many people go and look around it. {St. Leonard's Church,}Beoley is the oldest church in these parts. It is a medieval church and was completed by the{Sheldon Family}who introduced the art of tapestry weaving to England.{ {St. George's}and{St. Stephen's}are both Victorian churches. St. Stephen's is the biggest church in Redditch and the vicar is the Reverend D. Salt. St. George's has the second biggest organ in the county. All three churches are in the{Church of England.}The church of{Our Lady of Mount Carmel,}opened in 1834, was the first{Roman Catholic church in the Gothic style to be built in England since the Reformation.
